explosives.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on the decomposition energy, though the substance contains nitro groups with its oxygen budget calculated at -156, and decomposes at about 230degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: No data available. The flash point is reported to be about 192degC (Sumitomo Chemical (1984)), which is "Not classified."

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing nitro groups with explosive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (water solubility: 6.19mg/L (25degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data))

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) bound to the elements other than carbon and hydrogen

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 630mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a liquid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible, though no evidence of death was found at the highest dose of 1.2mg/L in rat acute toxicity studies using the inhalation route of exposure (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the data on rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)): "Non-irritating to the skin."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the data on rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)): "Non-irritating to the eye."

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea-pig skin sensitization studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on in vitro reverse mutation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)) and chromosome aberration tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)), and in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related evidence of tumor formation observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction and offspring development in rat 3-generation reproduction studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)) and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981, 1989)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In rat single dose toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including reduced locomotor activity, abnormal respiration, piloerection, hypersensitivity, salivation, lacrimation, exophthalmos, muscular fasciculations, and limb or generalized ataxia were reported (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In the available rat and mouse subacute toxicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981, 1985)), cholinesterase inhibition and reduced body weight gains were reported. However, classification is not possible since no evidence of other general symptoms or pathological findings was observed at the doses tested.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours EbC50=17microg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=4.62 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.
